Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient expressed a desire to discuss coping strategies for feeling overwhelmed, indicating a need for support in managing stress
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient reported feeling empowered after reaching out to event planning companies, despite initial nervousness. They are excited yet anxious about an upcoming informal chat, expressing a desire to convey their passion for event planning and willingness to learn during the meeting. The patient also shared that they had a tough conversation with their daughters about the divorce, which went better than expected due to honesty and allowing them to express their feelings
Current Functional Status: The patient has made progress in communication with their daughters, having heart-to-heart talks that strengthen their relationship during the transition
Progress Evaluation: The patient is showing improvement in handling stress and communication with their children, indicating positive development in their emotional well-being
Therapeutic Interventions: The plan includes exploring mindfulness techniques and stress management strategies to help the patient cope with feelings of overwhelm
Next Steps: The next session will focus on coping strategies, ensuring the patient feels supported in their journey
